prompt: <description>**Part 1: 3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Cutout** The first part of the CAD assembly is a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one of its faces. This part will be constructed in the following steps: 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** - The euler angles for the coordinate system are [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] degrees. - The translation vector for the coordinate system is [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system.** 3. **Create the first face of the sketch.** - The first loop of the face is a rectangle with the following lines: - Line 1: Starting point [0.0, 0.0], ending point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Starting point [0.75, 0.0], ending point [0.75, 0.6964] - Line 3: Starting point [0.75, 0.6964], ending point [0.0, 0.6964] - Line 4: Starting point [0.0, 0.6964], ending point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Create the second face of the sketch.** - The second loop of the face is a triangle with the following lines: - Line 1: Starting point [0.0536, 0.0536], ending point [0.6964, 0.0536] - Line 2: Starting point [0.6964, 0.0536], ending point [0.6964, 0.6429] - Line 3: Starting point [0.6964, 0.6429], ending point [0.0536, 0.6429] - Line 4: Starting point [0.0536, 0.6429], ending point [0.0536, 0.0536] 5. **Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75.** 6. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the coordinate system.** 7. **Extrude the 3D sketch to a depth of 0.1071 units in the normal direction.** The resulting part will have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.1071 units This part will be used as the base for constructing the final CAD model.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Long Cylindrical Object with Tapered End and Holes Step 1: Create Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0116. This will define the orientation and location of the CAD part. Step 2: Create 2D Sketch Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created earlier. Step 3: Draw Curves for Face 1 Draw the following curves to form a closed loop for Face 1: 1. Line 1: Start Point - (0.0, 0.0), End Point - (0.0057, 0.0) 2. Line 2: Start Point - (0.0057, 0.0), End Point - (0.0057, 0.008) 3. Line 3: Start Point - (0.0057, 0.008), End Point - (0.0, 0.008) 4. Arc 1: Start Point - (0.0, 0.008), Mid Point - (0.0307, 0.004), End Point - (0.0, 0.0) This loop defines the shape for the first extrusion, creating a tapered end. Step 4: Scale 2D Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0307 (sketch\\_scale) along all directions uniformly. This resizes the tapered end shape proportionally. Step 5: Transform 2D Sketch to 3D Sketch Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the given euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. This orients the 2D sketch as per the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude Sketch Extrude Face 1 along the Z-axis for a distance of 0.75 towards the opposite direction of the normal to create the first intermediate CAD part. There are no holes or other faces in this shape. The length is 0.0307 (inferred from sketch\\_scale), the width is 0.75 (from extrusion), and the height is equal to the length at 0.0307.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a face with the following loop: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.75] + Line 3: Start Point [0.375, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.375 towards the normal and by a depth of 0 towards the opposite direction of the normal. The sketch scaling parameter should be set to 0.75. This operation results in the creation of a new solid body. Part 2: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Cutout Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0656, 0.0, 0.0937]. For the sketch, create a face with the following loop: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2438, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.2438, 0.0], End Point [0.2438, 0.1875] + Line 3: Start Point [0.2438, 0.1875], End Point [0.0, 0.1875] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1875], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.0 towards the normal and by a depth of 0.75 towards the opposite direction of the normal. The sketch scaling parameter should be set to 0.2438. This operation cuts material from the existing body. Part 3: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Object with Cylindrical Cutouts Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.1313, 0.1688, 0.375]. For the sketch, create two faces, each with its own loop: * Face 1, Loop 1: + Circle 1: Center [0.0562, 0.0562], Radius 0.0562 * Face 2, Loop 1: + Circle 1: Center [0.0562, 0.3562], Radius 0.0562 Extrude the sketches by a depth of 0.0 towards the normal and by a depth of 0.225 towards the opposite direction of the normal. The sketch scaling parameter should be set to 0.4125. This operation cuts material from the existing body.</description>
